title: Rebecca Judd says she's tempted to leave her husband Chris for dating app Raya
text:
Rebecca Judd's curiosity got the better of her during a discussion about dating apps on her KIIS FM radio show, The 3pm Pick-Up, on Monday.

The 36-year-old and her co-hosts, Katie 'Monty' Dimond and Yumi Stynes, were chatting with actress Olympia Valance about the exclusive dating app, Raya, when Rebecca said she was tempted to give it a go.

'I just want to get on it to see who's on there... [I'll] dump my husband and then go on a dating app!' she joked.

Scroll down for audio

'I just want to see who's on there!' Rebecca Judd (right) joked on Monday that she is tempted to leave her husband Chris (left) so she can sign up for celebrity dating app Raya

But Monty thought she may have been taking things too far, saying a divorce wasn't necessary if Rebecca simply wanted to have a casual swipe through.

'We can tell him. You don't have to dump him yet,' she said, before adding, 'Unless you find someone better on the app!'

The discussion started after Olympia, 26, revealed last week she had met her AFL star boyfriend Thomas Bellchambers, 30, on Raya.

Taking it offline: The discussion was inspired by Olympia Valance (left) revealing last week that she had met her boyfriend Thomas Bellchambers (right) on Raya

'We met on a dating app! It's this app for people that are in the public eye,' she explained during an interview with Nova 96.9's Fitzy & Wippa.

Olympia said they started chatting on Raya and soon realised they lived close to one another in Melbourne.

And according to the former Neighbours star, the invite-only dating app is teeming with famous faces.

Having a laugh: 'I just want to get on it to see who's on there... [I'll] dump my husband and then go on a dating app!' Rebecca said jokingly. Pictured with Chris

'So many people... There were some really big stars!' she told the radio program.

While Olympia refused to name anyone, she strongly hinted that Formula One star Lewis Hamilton was one of the stars she encountered on the app.

Curiosity aside, it's unlikely Rebecca will be signing up for Raya anytime soon.

Solid: Curiosity aside, it's unlikely Rebecca will be signing up for Raya anytime soon as she is happily married to Chris, with whom she shares four children: Oscar, Billy, Tom and Darcy

In an interview with The Sydney Morning Herald in May, the radio presenter said that seeing her parents get divorced when she was a child made her 'absolutely determined to keep things together' with Chris.

'Growing up, I hated that I didn't have my mum and dad together,' she said. 'Everyone else seemed to have mum and dad living together, and I'd see dad at weekends.'

Rebecca married AFL player Chris Judd in 2010. The couple share four children: son Oscar, eight, daughter Billie, five, and three-year-old twins Tom and Darcy.
description: Rebecca Judd's curiosity got the better of her during a discussion about dating apps on her KIIS FM radio show, The 3pm Pick-Up, on Monday.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
